3.3.0 is buggy 

Fraps 3.3.2 - 9th Mar 2011
- Added detection of mouse buttons (Mouse3, Mouse4 & Mouse5 can be used as hotkeys)
- Added support for all Ctrl, Shift & Alt combinations for use with Fraps hotkeys

Fraps 3.3.1 - 1st Mar 2011
- Fixed Fraps not detecting Agrar Simulator 2011 and some D3D9Ex applications
- Fixed wrong capture dimensions for Fallout 3/New Vegas & Milkdrop
- Fixed counter showing over frames in IE9 beta
- Fixed stereoscopic capture not working in half-size mode for some games
- Additional minor bug fixes

Fraps 3.3.0 - 22nd Feb 2011
- Full support for Windows 7 SP1
- Added option to only capture external sound input while hotkey pushed (Vista/Win7)
- Fixed stereoscopic 3D capture not working for D3D9 games
- Fixed counter not appearing in Dungeons

Hi hellboy, you're upload doesn't seem to work. I've tried various compatibility modes, tried straight from the .exe file. Maybe it's been blacklisted? I have no idea how fraps works with it's anti piracy stuff. 

I use Xfire to record video, it's free and don't let the haters get to you they probably haven't used it in the last 3-4 years, Xfire works VERY good , much improved over the last few  years. Xfire now uses less CPU / GPU resources w/ minimal hardware lagg. I just can't get Xfire to record older games like Max Payne, Quake II etc. which is what I'm tryna do right now. 

I just thought I'd try FRAPS out, but I guess I'll have to check an older or newer version of FRAPS instead. Thanks for the effort though homey. I see yo have a green skull, I hope to see a new torrent for FRAPS out soon ;)

- Added configurable buffer size for loop recording mode
- Increased video capture performance at high resolutions

- Fixed benchmark crashing when configured to stop automatically after 1 second
